newsitem.title: USA: MCI SEC filing says BT merger on track.
newsitem.headline: MCI SEC filing says BT merger on track.

text.p: MCI Communications Corp said in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission last week that it expects its multi-billion dollar merger with British Telecommunications Plc to be completed this fall, pending the U.S. government's approval.
"Completion of the merger, which is subject to approval by the U.S. Federal Communications Commission, is expected by the fall of 1997," MCI said in its quarterly financial statement.
MCI reached a merger agreement with British Telecom in November 1996.

The latest filing did not say that the terms of the transaction have changed. If the deal had been materially changed, the company would be required under federal securities laws to disclose such changes in the filing.
Officials at the Securities and Exchange Commission declined to comment on the filing.

Under the terms of the merger agreement, each outstanding MCI share, including Class A shares, will be converted into the right to receive 0.54 American depository shares of Concert Plc, the new combined company, the SEC filing said.
